message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.HC 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) because it deals with natural language processing and text segmentation. The paper also mentions the use of algorithms such as TextTiling and BayesSeg, which are commonly used in the field of computational linguistics. 

The paper could also belong to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) because it deals with the task of making oral histories more accessible online, which involves organizing and retrieving information. 

Additionally, the paper touches on the topic of machine learning and statistical modeling, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.SD (Software Engineering). 

The paper also discusses the challenges of human agreement in segmenting oral histories, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Finally, the paper deals with the task of making oral histories more accessible to a wider audience, which could place it in the sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
